title: France Foreign Exchange Reserves
description: Foreign Exchange Reserves in France decreased to 238.28 EUR Billion in October from 243.54 EUR Billion in September of 2022. Foreign Exchange Reserves in France averaged 79.70 EUR Billion from 1972 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 245.99 EUR Billion in April of 2022 and a record low of 5.29 EUR Billion in February of 1974. In France, the international reserves include external assets that are directly and effectively controlled by the Banque de France, readily available, denominated in foreign currency and meeting the criterion of residency. Only claims on nonresident of the Euro-area are considered as reserve assets. The international reserve assets are recorded on the basis of gross reserve asset concept. This page provides the latest reported value for - France Foreign Exchange Reserves - plus previous releases, historical high and low, short-term forecast and long-term prediction, economic calendar, survey consensus and news.
author: Ministere de l'Économie, des Finances, de l'Action et des Comptes publics, France
